item.title: Path Of Exile 2: Secrets In The Dark Quest Walkthrough
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Clearfell And The Grelwood In Path Of Exile 2
  • The Red Vale’s Obelisks Of Rust In Path Of Exile 2
  • The Tree Of Souls In Path Of Exile 2

Path of Exile 2 is enshrouded with mystery and darkness. Every quest you take raises more questions than answers and every new area you discover is more dangerous than before. On the other hand, when it comes to how souls-like the world and lore feel, the game immediately introduces you to the darkness and sorrow the people live through, especially when Renly asks you to slay the Devourer in Path of Exile 2 .

The next mission you get is the Secrets in the Dark quest where you have to travel through three areas and investigate what happened to Count Geonor when he became mad.

Clearfell And The Grelwood In Path Of Exile 2

The Secrets in the Dark quest in Path of Exile 2 starts when you speak to Una in the Clearfell encampment. Una tells you that all this madness started when Count Geonor took his men and went to the Grelwood. She asks you to go there and search for clues, prompting the following objective:

  • Travel through Clearfel to the Grelwood

That means to reach the Grelwood, you have to travel through Clearfel l. Luckily, Clearfell is right after the safe zone.

While maps are randomized in Path of Exile 2 , Clearfell is always the same. When you enter the area, keep heading northeast, and you’ll eventually find the Grelwood entrance .

Once you make it inside Grelwood, your objective changes to:

  • Search the Grelwood for evidence of the Count’s activities

It gets tricky to find your destination inside the Grelwood since maps constantly change in Path of Exile 2 . However, no matter which side you start from, always head to the middle of the area to find the Tree of Souls and a Waypoint right next to it.

You can summon Una and speak to her next to the Tree of Souls. She explains that you must travel to the Red Vale, investigate its runes, and bring them back to Renly.

The Red Vale’s Obelisks Of Rust In Path Of Exile 2

To find the Red Vale’s entrance in Path of Exile 2 , you have to go in the opposite direction from where you came from . For example, if you entered the Grelwood from the far east, then the Red Vale’s entrance is in the far west of the area.

Inside the Red Vale, your objective will change to:

  • Search the Red Vale for Obelisks of Rust containing Runes of Power

You have to find the three Obelisks of Rust scattered around. They’re mostly scattered in the center with a river in the way. Usually, if you come across Refined Arms in that area, it means you’re on the right track .

The first two Obelisks of Rust summon many enemies that will crowd and overwhelm your character. However, the last one summons the Rust King who will also try to overwhelm your character with tons of enemies.

The Tree Of Souls In Path Of Exile 2

After beating the Rust King and finding the runes, bring them back to Renly, who’ll create three Rune Spikes from them. The quest’s objective will change to:

  • Travel to the Grelwood

Take the Spikes and stab the Tree of Souls in each of its Runic Seals . Once you do that, you’ll get an objective to return to Clearfell encampment and speak to Una. Doing so will complete the Secrets in the Dark quest and start the Mysterious Shade quest in Path of Exile 2 .

item.title: 5 Video Game Villains Who Romance The Heroes
item.description:
The subject of love is one that has fascinated and frustrated artists, poets, and scholars for millennia. The result is the creation of many a narrative about odd circumstances from which love can arise. Somewhat fascinating love stories arise from romantic liaisons between good and evil.

These can be fun, in part because of the idea of love as this all-conquering force. Sometimes love can overcome any barrier, other times it is merely a false pretense from which another agenda ends up being carried out. Whatever the case, through various circumstances, these characters can find themselves romantically involved with the heroes.

5 Maria Thorpe

A Star-Crossed Lover

As a straightforward example of this kind of character, Maria was an English noblewoman who was a templar, in love with Altaïr, a Levantine assassin, who acted in direct opposition to the templars. Maria first met her future betrothed when she was used by her superior as a decoy to trick Altaïr, although the assassin did not kill Maria, either. Maria is notably a tomboyish character, participating in fights and at times, acting as a man, due to how little women were allowed to participate in war. Unfortunately, for a long time, she channeled her drive to fight for glory towards the efforts of the Crusades. That said, once she was aligned with Altaïr, she was able to act as his voice of reason.

Maria inadvertently fed Altaïr information about the Templar Order while they were still technically enemies. Eventually, Maria grew to oppose a New World Order, the ultimate goal of the templars, and consciously allied with Altaïr directly. After Altaïr killed the Grand Master of the Templar Order, Armand Bouchart, he settled down with Maria. The pair married and had two sons, the youngest of whom, Sef, was a maternal ancestor to Desmond Miles. Unfortunately, siding with the heroes did not save Maria's life, as she was killed by Swami, another member of the Levantine Brotherhood of Assassins, who gained power as the organization became corrupted and forgot its creed. Altaïr was deeply traumatized by her death for the remainder of his life.

4 Benny

A Foe With Benefits

Sometimes the gender of a player's avatar can significantly alter the trajectory of romanceable characters. Although more recent games have gotten better at representing different sexualities, it is still a fact that some characters only go for a certain sex, in a way that can change the gameplay. Thus, certain characters are only avilable partners for a certain gender. One example of the following is Benny, from Fallout: New Vegas .

Benny is a subordinate to Mr. House, having been part of one of the tribes who supported his control of Vegas. This gave him control and access to House's technology, while those in opposition were displaced, suffering death and starvation. Nonetheless, this new power still wasn't enough for him, and he actively conspires to take over New Vegas under House's nose. His duplicitous nature makes him disliked by virtually everyone who knows about him.

Although he is played by the late Matthew Perry, who was known for starring in films and television with an emphasis on romance, Benny is probably one of his least romantic characters. He first encounters Courier Six and shoots them in the head, to steal the package they were delivering, not exactly anyone's ideal meet-cute. Nonetheless, a female courier, specifically one with the Black Widow perk, is capable of sleeping with him anyway. He will be somewhat confused as to why someone like the courier, who is against him, wants to sleep with him, but will still ultimately take the player to his room if they want.

This can be a pretense to kill him on the Las Vegas strip, although the player can leave him alone after the deed is done if they desire. This will result in him being subsequently found in Caesar's tent, where his exact fate is once again left up to the player. Although this relationship is far from affectionate, the player can take extra steps to ensure Benny is freed from the Legion, but after this point, they will never see him again.

3 Megaera

A Romanceable Boss Character

Hades makes the most out of the more repetitive aspects of its structure. This is partially achieved through the affinity system, which allows Zagreus to build bonds with the characters he continually meets throughout the game's four levels and the hub world. One such character is Megaera, the eldest of the fury sisters. She is tasked by Hades to help take care of matters in the Underworld and torture transgressors. To this end, she is tasked to battle Zagreus, being the first boss in the game he must face before escaping Tartarus.

This boss fight can vary once played enough times. Frustrated with Megaera's supposed incompetence, Hades will occasionally swap her out with one of her younger, scarier sisters, Alecto or Tisiphone, neither of whom are allowed in the House of Hades. It is also possible to fight all three of the furies at once.

As Zagreus made his initial attempts to leave the Underworld, Megaera grew cold towards him. However, as Zagreus began to rebuild his relationship with his father, Megaera and him managed to repair their own friendship. Depending on the player's actions, the story can go further. Maximum affinity with Megaera allows her the option to romance Zagreus, which the player can choose to accept. Furthermore, the two have the option of not being exclusive. Megaera is one of three love interests Zagreus can have. Most notably, Megaera can engage in a polyamorous relationship with both Zagreus and Thanatos, providing that Zagreus has maxed out affinity with the pair and entered separate romantic relationships with each of them.

2 Gangrel

The Madly In Love King

"Mad King" Gangrel is the earliest major villain in Fire Emblem: Awakening . He is the initial ruler of Plegia, who started as a common thief. Apparently descended from nobility, he reclaimed power by allying with the Grimleal, a religious cult centered around the Fell Dragon, Grima. Although Gangrel is not an adherent to the cult, he used their influence to secure his own position and considered himself a "Grimleal in name only."

For the first stretch of Awakening , he makes an active effort to instigate a war. The end result is a lot of needless bloodshed that ends with his presumed death. He is known to treat his subordinates poorly and relish the cruelty his power affords him. His crass speech and upfront manner of being are also in contrast to the manners of most rulers in the game, likely to highlight his background as a lower-class criminal. His actions led to the Ylissean Exalt, Emmeryn, attempting suicide in a failed gambit to prevent the subsequent war. Although she survived, the fall she took in the attempt gave her severe brain damage and rendered her amnesiac. She was also presumed dead prior to being potentially recovered by the Shepherds.

After Gangrel's own presumed death, he joins a Ylissean pirate crew led by a berserker known as Zanth. Here, he was mistreated by the pirate, and left to stew over all the horrible selfish actions he committed. In spite of all the suffering Chrom endured at his hand, he is still capable of recruiting Gangrel, by talking to the fallen king during three separate turns. The ultimate result is Gangrel agreeing he would rather die for Chrom's cause than continue working under Zanth. His fate after the war is unclear, with the only consensus being that he died "within a matter of years."

In spite of it all, Gangrel is capable of finding love with a female Robin, as well as fathering her son, Morgan. After a series of support conversations where Gangrel makes an effort to scout her for his own purposes, a potential final support conversation can be unlocked if Robin is unmarried. In this conversation, Gangrel reveals his requests were little more than a pretense to ask Robin for her hand in marriage. Although moderately unnerved, Robin ultimately accepts, claiming she would be "honored" to share her life with him. Staring at his betrothed, he questions how "she got [him] to love [her]," and claims that if she's trying to make a new man out of him, it's working. His exact fate in this timeline of events is unclear, but like any other partner taken by an incarnation of Robin, scholars agree that she loved him above all else.

1 Dahlia Hawthorne

A Toxic Relationship

Although there is a turbulent nature to college romance, few were likely as disastrous as Phoenix Wright's relationship with Dahlia Hawthorne. Hawthorne was a deeply self-interested woman who had committed multiple murders to cover up her crimes. She was notably involved as both a witness and the ultimate culprit in the first two trials of Mia Fey. She poisoned the coffee of Mia's colleague and eventual boyfriend, Diego Armando, resulting in him falling into a coma until a couple of years after her murder.

She achieved this by using a bottle necklace with poison stolen from her then-boyfriend, Doug Swallow. She subsequently planted the evidence on a young, law-illiterate, Phoenix Wright, as a "love gift." She planned to kill Wright, but her near-identical twin, Iris, instead persuaded her to merely retrieve the necklace. To this end, Iris swapped places with her sister, and developed a genuine romance with Wright. However, this did not stop Hawthorne from using that pretense to her own selfish ends.

Becoming frustrated with her sister's inability to retrieve the necklace, Dahlia tried to poison Wright's cold medicine. However, Doug Swallow wished to warn Wright of his girlfriend's duplicitous nature. Unfortunately, this only led to Wright's anger, with him pushing Doug and escaping, before Dahlia electrocuted him to death with nearby power cables.

This resulted in Wright being the prime suspect for murder, with Mia Fey acting as his defense attorney. Although it took extra effort on Mia's part to break Wright from her sway, she succeeded in proving Dahlia was the guilty party, which resulted in her eventual execution. The whole incident was deeply traumatic for Wright, and he refused to discuss it with anyone for quite some time as a result. From that point forward, Phoenix dedicated himself to studying law, and became a protégé of Mia Fey, before her untimely demise. Phoenix would later find out the truth about his romance with Iris, whose existence Phoenix was unaware of until years later.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Makes Iconic Moon Knight Meme an Official Part of its Lore
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Marvel Rivals has made a popular Moon Knight meme canon to the character's in-game lore, delighting fans.
  • The meme references Moon Knight asking Dracula for money, even though the characters rarely meet in Marvel Comics.
  • Marvel Rivals recently crossed a huge player count milestone just 72 hours after its main launch.

A Marvel Rivals player has shared a fantastic link to a popular Moon Knight meme derived from Marvel Comics, and it’s now become part of the shooter’s lore. Marc Spector’s vigilante has become a popular character to play in Marvel Rivals , the recently released live-service game, and the developer had a wealth of history to dive into from creator Doug Moench's Marvel Comics library, compiling the superhero’s various runs after a debut appearance in Werewolf by Night #32 .

The third-person hero shooter launched on December 6 by NetEase Games, hosting 6v6 PvP gameplay with a stacked roster, including Wolverine, Black Widow, Spider-Man, and Thor. Marvel Rivals recently crossed a huge player count milestone just 72 hours after its main launch, and gamers have recently been raving about the online multiplayer’s adrenaline-fueled action and map scale, with some even preferring it to Blizzard Entertainment’s popular shooter Overwatch .

Posted on Reddit by RiskE80Twitch, screenshots were shared within the Marvel Rivals subreddit, highlighting a piece of dialogue from Moon Knight’s lore in the shooter. The snippet says, “'What do you know of vampires?' Konshu asked curiously. 'That they suck,' Spector responded with a chuckle. 'And that Dracula owes me money,'” and some fans may be unaware that this is pulled directly from a meme. A second screenshot showed the popular meme of Moon Knight asking Dracula for money through profanity, which is an edited version of the hero entering Shroud’s castle in Solo Avengers #3 from 1988. The Egyptian-rooted superhero was a popular addition to the shooter’s roster, but players want to see more memes added to the game, including Marvel Rivals ' potential addition of Morbius to create the "Morbin' Time" meme.

Marvel Rivals Makes Hilarious Moon Knight Meme Canon

In keeping with the heroes’ canon weaponry, Marvel Rivals players noticed a neat ability Moon Knight’s Ankh produced. Unlike the ability, the Dracula meme isn’t canon at all, but rather a comical headcanon suggested to air another of Moon Knight’s personalities. The original comic showed Moon Knight traversing Shroud’s lair within a gauntlet of bobby traps, but the first panel of the character descending the stairs was photoshopped back in 2018 to change the context entirely.

Marvel Rivals ’ Moon Knight reveal accidentally spoiled Hawkeye’s arrival to the game, but there’s bound to be plenty of other surprises in store during the game’s infancy. Some Marvel fans believe Marvel Rivals and the Marvel Cinematic Universe could have a synergetic relationship going forward, where the live-service game could use plot points from the MCU to inspire upcoming events. It would be a great way to connect the Marvel pantheon through different mediums, and the shooter is off to a flying start in sales.

item.title: Indiana Jones And The Great Circle: How To Solve Seat Of Eternity Mystery
item.description:
The Seat of Eternity is a mystery found while exploring Gizeh in Indiana Jones and the Great Circle . The mystery is actually part of the Riddles of the Ancients, as after solving the Canopic Jars puzzle you will receive an Ancient Relic as a reward.

Completing the mystery in Indiana Jones and the Great Circle is not necessary, nor does it affect the main story. In fact, you can ignore it completely, but it does reward some Adventure Points, which are necessary to unlock new skills for Indy.

How To Solve The Seat Of Eternity Mystery In Indiana Jones And The Great Circle

Head northwest from the Great Sphinx to find a small hill with square-shaped holes. Jump into the hole to find yourself in a tomb with a sealed sarcophagus. There is a paper next to the sarcophagus that you can read to find out more about the mystery.

But to trigger the Seat of Eternity, pick up the nearby Falcon Canopic Jar and place it on one of the pressure plates to start the Seat of Eternity mystery. Indy needs to find all the missing Canopic Jars and place them on the correct pressure plates.

Go out of the sarcophagus room and turn left to find a hole. Jump inside to find the Human Canopic Jar and a heavy metal weapon. Throw both of the items to the higher platform, then look up and use the whip to climb up. Place the Jar in front of the mural with a Human Canopic Jar on it.

Grab the weapon you threw previously and destroy the cracked wall found on the right side, outside the sarcophagus room. Enter and grab the Baboon Canopic Jar , then place it on the pressure plate in front of the matching mural.

Head to the same hole you got the weapon from, but this time, use the whip to swing to the other side. Open the door on the left by pulling the hook with the whip and grab the Jackal Canopic Jar . Return to the sarcophagus and place it in front of the mural with the destroyed head.

Finally, grab the Falcon Canopic Jar which you previously placed randomly, and place it in front of the correct mural.

To summarize, in the sarcophagus room, place the Human, Falcon, Jackal, and the Baboon Canopic Jars from left to right . Shortly after the puzzle is solved, the sarcophagus will unlock, revealing an Ancient Relic, ending the Seat of Eternity mystery and rewarding Indy with 225 Adventure Points.

item.title: Amazing Marvel Rivals Cyclops Fan Concept Looks Like The Real Deal
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • A Marvel Rivals fan recently designed an impressive concept for renowned X-Men character Cyclops.
  • The Cyclops concept design perfectly matches Marvel Rivals' distinctive art style, leading many to believe it was a leak at first.
  • Community demand for Cyclops' addition in Marvel Rivals is quite high, but developer NetEase Games has yet to confirm the same.

A Marvel Rivals fan recently came up with an excellent concept design for Cyclops that could fit in perfectly with the hero shooter's distinctive art style. Although Cyclops is not yet available in the Marvel Rivals roster, the community has been exhibiting significant demand for the addition of the prominent X-Men character.

Cyclops is one of the most renowned X-Men members in the Marvel universe thanks to his unique ability to fire psionic laser beams from his eyes. To control the unchecked power of his optic lasers, Cyclops wears a visor on his face, which has become his defining aesthetic feature over the years. He's also a founding member and the leader of the X-Men in the comics, making Cyclops' omission from Marvel Rivals a bit odd, especially since the game features other X-Men characters like Magneto, Wolverine, Storm, Magik, Psylocke, and Scarlet Witch.

While developer NetEase Games has yet to confirm whether Cyclops will join Marvel Rivals down the line, players have taken it upon themselves in the meantime to envision what the X-Men leader may look and play like in the hero shooter. A few months ago, one Marvel Rivals fan designed a full kit for Cyclops that outlined some potential attacks and abilities he could possess. Now, Reddit user Responsible-Ad394 has gone the extra mile with an all-out Marvel Rivals concept design for Cyclops that impeccably incorporates the game's art style.

Marvel Rivals Fan Designs Extremely Convincing Cyclops Character Concept

The concept design shows Cyclops standing proud in a brown and blue X-Men uniform, complete with red and yellow accents, the utility belt, "X" chest emblem, and of course, his iconic yellow visor. To top it off, Responsible-Ad394 positioned their Cyclops concept design against a background with a stylized silhouette of the character to make it look almost exactly like a Marvel Rivals hero profile. Needless to say, several Reddit users admitted in the comments that they were initially tricked into believing the Cyclops design was a leaked character for Marvel Rivals , and subsequently felt disappointed that it was just a concept.

There's clearly a lot of demand for Cyclops in Marvel Rivals , so it remains to be seen if NetEase Games is cognizant of the same and plans to add him to the hero shooter's playable roster in the near future. Since Cyclops is a powerful character in the comics, it should be interesting to see how Marvel Rivals could adapt his psionic lasers. Long-range combat is almost a given, but melee attacks could be tricky. However, if bizarre characters like Jeff the Land Shark can be in Marvel Rivals , then Cyclops doesn't seem too optimistic a choice.
